title.narrative: Sustainable energy systems for urban-industrial development

description.narrative:
South Africa´s high GHG emissions are caused by its heavy reliance on coal. The energy intensive industry sector is significantly contributing to increasing of GHG emissions. Fostering sustainable energy solutions in industrial activities is thus imperative for embarking on a pathway towards decarbonizing the economy. At the same time, due to challenges with integrated urban planning, municipalities in South Africa are expanding in a resource-intensive and inefficient manner. Here, industrial parks (IP) offer a significant potential of addressing the two problems above, by adopting sustainable energy concepts and contributing to the development of more sustainable municipalities.
This project's objective is to reduce GHG emissions and accelerate the decarbonization of industrial parks and other related environmental impacts, by addressing both energy supply and demand side, through an approach that considers the "urban-industrial-energy nexus".
